0.cdata!:
Programa nacional de administracion de
            tierras de Panama : plan de participacion indigena

trustfund: TF025367-PHRD-LAND MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF025501-PHRD-LAND ADMINISTRATION,TF040956-HONDURAS: LAND AMINISTRATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The Land Administration Project in
            Panama aims at consolidating protected areas, and indigenous
            territories, strengthening institutional, and local
            capacity, and regularizing land tenure. The restructured
            project development objective is to modernize the land
            administration system including priority protected areas and
            indigenous territories. Potential negative impacts may come
            about through interventions related with the demarcation of
            common lands, titling of large land holdings, and,
            consolidation, and expansion of protected areas. Mitigating
            measures include: 1) revision, and adoption of current
            social objectives of the agrarian legislation, focusing on
            the interpretation, and application of the rule of law,
            particularly on deforestation concessions; 2) clarifications
            on the definition of agro-ecological land quality
            indicators, and, include the social concept of titling land
            holdings to small farmers; 3) implementation of tenure
            studies to prevent speculation on land pricing, and, to
            provide precise information on land occupancy, and uses; 4)
            regulation of involuntary resettlement, particularly
            regarding patrimonial lands, ensuring land ownership to
            vulnerable groups, including women.
